content.raw:
I just remembered that last question about copyright. Naturally it is under
the same license as the rest of Pyteomics. As for attribution, we should
share authorship since this is derivative of your original Unimod interface.

The warning suppression issue is likely cosmetic, as unicode vs byte string
input does not matter as the underlying buffer is unchanged. The only time
it matters is when reading out, during which time the RDBMS or ORM has
already enforced an encoding.
content.html:
I just remembered that last question about copyright. Naturally it is under the same license as the rest of Pyteomics. As for attribution, we should share authorship since this is derivative of your original Unimod interface.

The warning suppression issue is likely cosmetic, as unicode vs byte string input does not matter as the underlying buffer is unchanged. The only time it matters is when reading out, during which time the RDBMS or ORM has already enforced an encoding.
